title: Ripple (XRP) vs SEC Case as of August 7: Plans to Drop Appeals
body: As the long-running legal dispute between Ripple Labs and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission nears another procedural milestone, attention is shifting to whether both parties will meet the court-imposed deadline of August 15. That date marks the scheduled filing of a joint status update , which is expected to clarify the standing of remaining appeals in the case. The potential for a decisive conclusion or a further extension has led to renewed analysis of the parties‚Äô likely strategies. In a recent conversation on X, former SEC attorney Marc Fagel offered insights into what could unfold by mid-August. Responding to a question from Zach Rector, who asked about the likelihood that Ripple and the SEC will drop their appeals by the deadline, Fagel stated that the parties are highly incentivized to have dismissals submitted by then or to be in a position to inform the court that dismissals are actively being processed. Implications for Case Closure Fagel‚Äôs statement adds to speculation that both sides may be aiming to conclude the remaining procedural matters without further delay. While Fagel refrained from making a specific prediction, his assessment shows that practical motivations are at play. According to him, the parties are incentivized to resolve outstanding appeals to avoid further court involvement or potential requests for additional extensions. In late June, Ripple announced that it would drop its cross-appeal . The community also expects the SEC to do the same, but no formal withdrawal has been recorded. The upcoming August 15 status update is therefore significant, as it may confirm whether both Ripple and the SEC are following through on their previously signaled intentions. Will Both Parties End the Lawsuit? Responding to a request for elaboration, Fagel noted that both sides intend to drop the appeals, suggesting that neither party would want to return to the Court of Appeals unprepared or request more time. He believes they want to avoid unnecessary delays, and their recent actions support this theory. Both parties clearly plan to drop their appeals. Neither wants to go to the Court of Appeals and say "we're not ready yet, please give us another extension on moving forward with the appeals." ‚Äî Marc Fagel (@Marc_Fagel) August 5, 2025 We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Both parties spent months for an indicative ruling from Judge Annalisa Torres on their settlement agreement, which would have lowered Ripple‚Äôs penalty from $125 million to $50 million and removed the permanent injunction preventing institutional XRP sales. After she denied their joint motion seeking the indicative ruling, Ripple expressed its desire to move on, reaffirming the previous ruling that XRP is not a security. With both parties eager to move on, August 15 might mark the end of the legal battle. Disclaimer : This content is meant to inform and should not be considered financial advice. The views expressed in this article may include the author‚Äôs personal opinions and do not represent Times Tabloid‚Äôs opinion. Readers are advised to conduct thorough research before making any investment decisions. Any action taken by the reader is strictly at their own risk. title: New Ethereum (ETH) Analysis from Standard Chartered! Which Trade is More Profitable?
body: Recently, the Ethereum ETF treasury strategy has increased and many companies have started to buy ETH. While the Ethereum trend is expected to continue in the coming years, a new analysis has come from Standard Chartered. Geoffrey Kendrick of Standard Chartered compared ETH ETFs to public companies buying Ethereum. Kendrick assessed that buying stocks of companies that buy ETH is better than buying Ethereum ETFs. According to Kendirck, Ethereum treasury companies have purchased 1.6% of all ETH in circulation since June, and that amount is now on par with ETH ETFs. At this point, the analyst said treasury holdings are now very investable and present a stronger argument for investors than US spot Ethereum ETFs. Kendrick noted that the net asset value (NAV) premiums for Ethereum treasury companies are now just above 1, making it a better buy option than US spot ETH ETFs due to staking and DeFi exposure. Kendrick added that ETH treasury holdings are expected to grow faster due to the increased acceptance of cryptocurrencies by institutions as institutional reserve assets and ETH‚Äôs ability to generate returns. *This is not investment advice. title: XRP Has Formed the Golden Entry. Analyst Says This Is Final Chance to Get Rich
body: A recent analysis from crypto analyst Steph Is Crypto (@Steph_iscrypto) has refocused attention on XRP‚Äôs price structure, highlighting what he calls a ‚ÄúGolden Entry‚Äù point. Drawing comparisons to XRP‚Äôs price action in late 2017, the analyst points to a recurring pattern that preceded XRP‚Äôs historic surge to its previous all-time high. Using monthly candlestick charts, Steph identifies a triangular consolidation phase that, in 2017, led directly into a significant breakout. His post suggests that XRP is once again in a similar technical setup. The Repeating Pattern The side-by-side charts in the post depict two distinct timeframes. The left panel shows XRP‚Äôs price activity in 2017, where the token moved from sub-cent levels to over $3.3. At the time, the asset experienced a clear breakout from a symmetrical triangle , which was followed by exponential gains. Steph marks this breakout as the Golden Entry, emphasizing its role as a strategic point for accumulation before XRP‚Äôs rapid ascent. The asset‚Äôs climb to a new all-time high in July has put it in a similar position. The chart on the right shows that this bull run remains active. Steph advises investors to accumulate now, as this may be a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. #XRP HAS FORMED THE GOLDEN ENTRY! This is your final chance to get rich. pic.twitter.com/4YH5Bqau7Q ‚Äî STEPH IS CRYPTO (@Steph_iscrypto) August 6, 2025 Current Market Context and Analyst‚Äôs View Steph‚Äôs assertion implies XRP may be poised for a substantial price movement, provided the pattern plays out comparably. It‚Äôs worth noting that XRP has seen major events since 2017, including regulatory challenges and ongoing litigation with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 However, the lawsuit is nearing a resolution , and this would remove a key overhang on XRP‚Äôs price, freeing it up for growth. Steph‚Äôs analysis focuses solely on chart structure and historical precedent, and provides a strong case for a new price discovery phase for XRP. Potential Implications for XRP Holders The concept of a Golden Entry suggests a narrow window of opportunity for strategic accumulation . For market participants who accept technical analysis as a decision-making tool, this signal may prompt increased interest in XRP. Steph‚Äôs analysis offers a perspective that may resonate with those who view XRP‚Äôs past performance as a guide to its future. The recurring triangle breakout pattern is visually compelling, but whether XRP can replicate its previous surge remains uncertain. For now, Steph Is Crypto‚Äôs post has positioned XRP‚Äôs current chart pattern as pivotal, and market observers will be watching closely to see if the breakout leads to the kind of rally seen in 2017. title: XRP Eyes Breakout Above $3.09 as South Korea‚Äôs BDACS Supercharges Institutional Adoption
body: XRP Hovers on the Edge ‚Äî Key Levels Define Next Direction XRP traded in a tight range, hitting a $3.02 intraday high before settling at $3 with a 24-hour jump of 2.2% being driven by surging demand and high-volume trading on Korean exchanges. This price action places XRP squarely within the range articulated by market analyst Adex crypt. The analyst noted , ‚ÄúXRP remains bearish below $3.02. A dip beneath $2.91 may lead to further declines toward $2.78, with extended targets at $2.60 and $2.45. However, a breakout above $3.09 could trigger bullish momentum, eyeing $3.40, $3.70, and $3.85.‚Äù Navigating this scenario, traders are watching key thresholds. Holding above $2.91 may stave off downside pressure, but should the price slip below that mark, a slide toward $2.78 and potentially a further drop toward $2.60 and $2.45 could unfold. Conversely, pushing firmly above $3.09 would unlock bullish potential, opening the door toward $3.40 and possibly stretching to $3.65 or even $3.85. Technically speaking, XRP has remained rangebound for now. Recent reports highlight resistance near $3.10 to $3.20, and a descending channel that‚Äôs muted upside. Meanwhile, on the fundamentals front, XRP‚Äôs flirtation with the $3 mark comes amid renewed regulatory developments. For instance, the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is scheduled to deliberate Ripple‚Äôs appeal withdrawal, while market participants show rising institutional interest, including ETF filings in Japan by SBI Holdings. BDACS Rolls Out Institutional-Grade Support for XRP South Korea just hit a major milestone in regulated crypto infrastructure as BDACS, a licensed cryptocurrency custodian, officially launches institutional-grade custody services for XRP. Born from its strategic partnership with Ripple, the rollout bridges the gap between regulatory compliance and institutional access to digital assets. Reliable Custody Meets Regulatory Compliance Through integration with Ripple Custody, Ripple‚Äôs enterprise-grade custody platform, BDACS now offers secure, compliant storage, management, and deployment of XRP for Korean banks, funds, and asset managers. Crucially, this system is tightly aligned with South Korea‚Äôs Financial Services Commission regulatory roadmap, addressing key institutional concerns around compliance and risk. Seamless Exchange Integration The service extends beyond custody. BDACS has connected with top domestic exchanges, such as Upbit, Coinone, and Korbit, enabling institutional clients to move XRP across Korea‚Äôs most liquid trading platforms with ease and full regulatory transparency. Why It Matters XRP is already among the most actively traded digital assets in Korea. Previously, institutions were hindered by fragmented options and insufficient custodial frameworks. With BDACS now offering regulated, onshore custody, institutional adoption barriers are being dismantled, paving the way for greater liquidity, stability, and long-term growth. Moreover, this initiative aligns with broader projections that crypto custody could manage trillions in assets by 2030, while digital asset tokenization could represent up to 10% of global GDP, signaling a shift toward token-based financial infrastructure. Broader Strategic Context This development marks the first tangible outcome of the BDACS‚ÄìRipple collaboration, building upon Ripple‚Äôs regional strategy to deepen institutional adoption across Asia. In addition to XRP, BDACS also supports RLUSD, Ripple‚Äôs U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin. The impact is already evident: South Korea is one of the world‚Äôs most crypto-engaged markets, with over 25% of individuals aged 20‚Äì50 holding digital assets with 4 in 10 expressing willingness to invest more if supported by regulated institutions. Conclusion BDACS‚Äôs institutional-grade support for XRP represents a significant leap forward for South Korea‚Äôs digital asset ecosystem. By offering compliant custody and seamless exchange access, the collaboration with Ripple sets new standards for institutional crypto participation, positioning XRP to play an increasingly central role in Asia‚Äôs evolving financial infrastructure. Meanwhile, XRP‚Äôs next move hinges on whether it can break and stay above the $3.09 barrier or if it falls back below $2.91.

title: India‚Äôs ED seizes $4.8M in assets tied to Coinbase spoofing scam mastermind
body: India‚Äôs Enforcement Directorate (ED) has seized assets worth ‚Çπ42.8 crore ($4.8 million) linked to Chirag Tomar, who defrauded thousands of investors across the globe by mimicking crypto exchange Coinbase. On Tuesday, officials at the financial crimes watchdog issued a press release detailing the seizure of 18 immovable properties in Delhi and multiple bank accounts held by Tomar, his relatives, and his business associates. The ED said the provisional attachment was carried out under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) after authorities traced illicit crypto funds funnelled into real estate and bank deposits in India. The attached properties include high-value real estate holdings across India‚Äôs capital, along with bank accounts containing laundered funds. According to the ED, these assets were acquired using proceeds from an international cryptocurrency phishing scheme that Tomar ran before his arrest in the United States in December 2023. Investigators found that Tomar had converted stolen digital assets into Indian rupees through peer-to-peer trading platforms and used the funds to purchase luxury items, including Lamborghinis, Porsches, and designer watches, as well as to finance foreign travel. A large portion of the stolen funds was funnelled into India and parked under the names of relatives and shell entities, the agency added. Ongoing probe and possible further action The ED began its probe after learning about Tomar‚Äôs arrest through international media reports. In February, it conducted coordinated raids across multiple locations in Delhi and Mumbai to trace the money trail. Officials say the investigation remains active and more seizures or arrests may follow. ‚ÄúThe proceeds of crime were layered and integrated into the banking system by purchasing immovable properties in India,‚Äù the ED noted in an accompanying statement. The agency has not ruled out further action against other accomplices who may have assisted Tomar in laundering funds domestically. Coinbase users targeted all across the globe Chirag Tomar, 31, was sentenced to 60 months in federal prison by a US court in October 2024 after pleading guilty to conspiracy to commit wire fraud. His scheme, which ran for over two years, involved creating spoofed websites that mimicked Coinbase, a leading cryptocurrency exchange with operations spanning several jurisdictions across the globe. The fake sites were designed to appear nearly identical to Coinbase‚Äôs official page but contained altered contact details. Tomar and his team even used search engine optimisation to ensure their counterfeit URLs ranked above genuine ones, making them easier for unsuspecting users to find. When users attempted to log in, the spoofed site would return error messages and direct them to the scammers, who then manipulated victims into sharing sensitive security codes or granting remote access to their devices. US prosecutors estimated that Tomar stole over $20 million in crypto assets, affecting hundreds of victims globally. Past court filings have even highlighted cases where individuals lost their life savings to the scam, including one North Carolina resident who lost more than $240,000 in a single incident. Tomar laundered over $72 million worth of crypto proceeds across multiple platforms, converting large portions into Indian rupees and investing them in property and other high-value assets. The ED alleges that several associates played a role in this laundering process, including those responsible for managing mule accounts and coordinating fund transfers. India emerges as a hotbed for crypto scams Over the past years, India has witnessed a surge in cases involving crypto-related financial crimes , from romance scams and phishing attacks to fraudulent coin offerings and Ponzi schemes. According to data from another crypto exchange, MEXC, India ranked first globally in detected crypto trading fraud in early 2025, with nearly 27,000 flagged accounts‚Äîmarking a 17% year-over-year increase. Much of this is due to a lack of financial literacy and the fact that the booming crypto sector in the country remains in a regulatory grey zone , with no comprehensive framework to govern digital asset platforms, protect consumers, or ensure accountability among service providers. The post India‚Äôs ED seizes $4.8M in assets tied to Coinbase spoofing scam mastermind appeared first on Invezz

title: 10 Best Binance Alternatives in 2025
body: Binance is one of the world‚Äôs leading crypto exchanges. It has handled over $128 trillion in transactions since 2017. The exchange lists around 400 cryptocurrencies and serves 280 million users. Yet, some people are switching due to regulations or wanting a different experience. If you‚Äôre looking for the best Binance alternatives, this guide is for you. Best Alternatives to Binance Coinbase: Best for crypto newbies who are looking for a simple and user-friendly platform. ChangeNOW : Best for traders and businesses focusing on Web3 trading. Kraken: Ideal for advanced trading tools and markets such as margin and derivatives trading. Bybit: Top choice for high leverage derivatives trading, including futures and options. OKX: Top for low trading fees and access to a wide range of cryptocurrencies. KuCoin: Best for overall advanced tools and peer-to-peer market. Gate: Excellent for altcoin hunters and high-frequency traders. Bitget: Best crypto exchange for high-volume copy trading of top-performing traders. Bitstamp: Best for fiat-focused traders who want a simple and regulated platform. MEXC: Excellent for traders chasing new token launches and a wide derivatives suite. Top Binance Alternatives Reviewed We tested 10 crypto exchanges based on the things that matter most to users across multiple jurisdictions. This includes listed cryptocurrencies, available pairs, trading fees, liquidity, and access to features like staking or margin trading. We also looked at security and whether each platform follows clear regulations. Coinbase:¬†Ideal for Beginners Coinbase is a U.S.-based crypto exchange that was founded in 2012 by Brian Armstrong and Fred Ehrsam. The exchange operates in over 100 countries, including the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Germany, Brazil, and more. Coinbase has amassed more than 100 million users globally, with a lifetime trading volume of several trillion dollars. Coinbase has 307 cryptocurrencies listed, including Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and more. The exchange offers 451 trading pairs and supports major fiat currencies such as USD, EUR, GBP, AUD, and more. Upon signing up, users are required to complete a verification process and connect a deposit link. Users can deposit funds through various channels, including bank wire transfers, ACH transfers, debit cards, and more. Deposit fees range from $0 to $10; however, debit card deposits incur a high fee of 3.99%. Crypto withdrawal fees are subject to network gas fees, while fiat withdrawal fees are free for ACH and SEPA transfers. Wire transfers cost $25. Coinbase offers spot trading, while margin trading is available through Coinbase Advanced. Options and derivatives trading became available on Coinbase International following the Deribit acquisition. In terms of trading fees, Coinbase uses a maker-taker model. Orders that are fulfilled immediately incur a taker fee ranging between 0.05% and 0.60%, while maker fees range from 0.00% to 0.40%. Coinbase enforces high security standards, storing assets in cold wallets. The platform also requires two-step verification for each account. Since Coinbase is incorporated in the United States, it adheres to regulatory requirements. The platform complies with KYC and AML regulations and holds various licenses both in the U.S. and internationally. Coinbase website Pros Simple onboarding process and clean interface. High liquidity with 307 coins and 451 trading pairs. Robust security measures. Cons Higher fees compared to other exchanges. Limited access to altcoins. Delayed customer support response. Why is Coinbase a good alternative to Binance? Coinbase is ideal for beginners who want to purchase their first cryptocurrency. The platform is easy to navigate and offers a simple user interface. Moreover, Coinbase provides clear instructions for buying, selling, and storing digital assets through its learning resources. For anyone seeking a trusted and regulated exchange, Coinbase remains one of the safest choices. ChangeNOW: Best for Web3 Finances ChangeNOW is a crypto exchange that caters to limitless Web3 trading. Established in 2017, ChangeNOW has amassed 5 million users from around the world due to its fast swaps. Anyone can start trading crypto assets on ChangeNOW with as little as $2 and no upper limit. The exchange is non-custodial, allowing users to maintain full control over their digital assets. Moreover, ChangeNOW users can set a permanent exchange address, streamlining crypto swaps. ChangeNOW has over 1,500 digital assets listed, including DeFi tokens, stablecoins, layer-1 and layer-2 tokens, AI coins, GameFi coins, and more. Moreover, ChangeNOW allows cross-chain transactions across 110 networks, including Ethereum, Solana, Binance Smart Chain, Polygon, Near, and Avalanche, to name a few. The exchange offers 2,250,000 trading pairs. ChangeNOW supports over 70 fiat currencies such as USD, EUR, AUD, HKD, and others, making it easy for beginners to acquire digital currencies. Users can deposit fiat and buy crypto through Visa, MasterCard, Google Pay, Apple Pay, FasterPay, SEPA, Pix, ACH, and Revolut. Around 98% of crypto swaps on ChangeNOW are completed at a better rate than initially quoted. A small deviation of 0.5% still results in a rate very close to the estimate. Most transactions are tracked in real time and fulfilled quickly‚Äîwithin 2 minutes. ChangeNOW has no hidden fees, as costs are included in the rate shown upfront. Customer support helps resolve complex issues like sending coins to the wrong address and is available 24/7 via email and live chat. ChangeNOW has a user satisfaction rating of 4.5 on TrustPilot, based on 13,000 reviews. ChangeNOW caters to experienced traders through ChangeNOW Pro, an advanced crypto management solution. ChangeNOW Pro is ideal for high-volume crypto trading. It offers different perks compared to the standard platform, such as cashback via the NOW token, competitive fees, and faster transactions. ChangeNOW also offers other products like NOW Wallet, NOW Tracker, and crypto loans. ChangeNOW website Pros Offers a diverse range of coin and trading pairs. No limit on transaction and trading size. Fast transactions and no hidden fees. Cons No margin or derivatives trading. Incurs high fees on debit and credit cards purchases. Copy trading is not supported. Why is ChangeNOW a good alternative to Binance? ChangeNOW is the best Binance alternative for traders who are looking for simplified swaps and privacy . The exchange is non-custodial and offers more coins and trading pairs compared to Binance. Moreover, ChangeNOW is available in regions where Binance faces regulatory restrictions, such as Canada and the UK. Kraken:¬†Top for Advanced Trading Features Kraken is one of the oldest and most trusted cryptocurrency exchanges. It was co-founded by Jesse Powell in 2011 and is headquartered in Wyoming. Kraken was created to provide secure Bitcoin trading before alternative coins like Ethereum and Litecoin existed. The 14-year-old exchange has over 15 million users across 190+ countries. Users can buy, sell, and trade 463 cryptocurrencies and 15 stablecoins like USDT and USDC. Kraken offers access to more than 11,000 stocks and ETFs for U.S.-based traders. Moreover, Kraken supports 10 major fiat currencies, including USD, EUR, CAD, AUD, GBP, CHF, JPY, ARS, BRL, and MXN. Kraken has several products, including the main Kraken trading app, Kraken Pro, Kraken Desktop, Kraken Institutional, Ink, and Kraken. The main Kraken app is designed for retail investors. It offers straightforward access to spot and futures trading markets, making trading accessible to everyone Kraken is a payment service competing with Binance Pay. This service lets casual users simply send fiat currencies like USD or EUR, or cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, to anyone worldwide. Krak operates in more than 160 countries and supports over 300 currencies. Kraken Pro and Kraken Desktop are designed for experienced traders who want to perform technical analysis using advanced charting tools. The Pro version also offers spot trading, margin contracts with up to 5X leverage, and futures contracts with up to 50X leverage. Availability of margin and futures contracts varies by the user‚Äôs country or region. Kraken has slightly higher trading fees. However, it has a tiered fee model with maker fees starting at 0.25% and taker fees at 0.40%. The exchange offers discounts for high-volume traders, and subscribing to Kraken+ can further reduce fees. Kraken has a user-friendly trading app available on iOS and Android. The crypto exchange is known for its responsive customer service. The exchange has 24/7 customer support through live chat, email, and phone support. Kraken‚Äôs customer support service supports more than 12 languages. Kraken has a user-friendly trading app available on iOS and Android. The exchange is known for its responsive customer service. It offers 24/7 support via live chat, email, and phone. Kraken‚Äôs customer support team covers more than 12 languages, including English, Dutch, German, and Chinese. Kraken implements strong security measures like two-factor authentication (2FA) and stores the majority of assets in cold storage. It has conducted proof-of-reserves (PoR) audits since 2014 and runs a bug-bounty program. Kraken has never experienced a hack or breach since its inception. Kraken website Pros Well-established exchange, operating for 14 years. Access to advanced trading like margin and futures markets. Regulated and highly secure crypto exchange with no hacks or breaches. Cons Advanced trading interfaces and tools are complex for beginners. Availability of services and products is limited in certain regions. Slow or delayed customer support response. Why is Kraken a good alternative to Binance? Kraken is a great alternative to Binance for experienced traders residing in North America and the Eurozone. It‚Äôs a well-established crypto exchange with no history of hacks or breaches, making it ideal for those seeking high security. Kraken is a versatile platform serving retail investors, high-volume traders, and institutional clients. Bybit:¬†Best of Futures Trading Bybit is one of the largest cryptocurrency exchanges, operating since 2018. It was founded by Ben Zhou and is currently headquartered in Dubai, UAE. It now serves over 74 million users and operates in 241 countries, making it a global exchange. Bybit has 2,093 cryptocurrencies listed, from Bitcoin and Ethereum to other altcoins. The exchange offers deep liquidity with high daily trading volumes in billions of dollars. Bybit supports various deposit methods through crypto and fiat currencies. Users can fund their accounts with crypto through network transfers or peer-to-peer (P2P) markets. The exchange supports a wide range of fiat currencies, including USD, EUR, GBP, CHF, and JPY. Users can fund their accounts through bank transfers or credit/debit cards. Fiat deposit fees vary by method and provider. Withdrawal fees vary depending on local banks and or payment services. Trading on Bybit‚Äôs spot markets has a flat maker and taker fee of 0.1%. Advanced trading on perpetual futures markets incurs maker fees of 0.02% and taker fees of 0.055%. Options traders pay maker fees of 0.02% and taker fees of 0.03%. Moreover, Bybit has a VIP tiered fee structure that reduces fees to as low as 0.015% maker and 0.005% taker fees. Traders with deep pockets and a risk appetite can leverage trade up to 100X. Bybit is compliant to international regulations, implementing strong KYC and AML measures for user identification processes. The platform restricts users seeking to buy crypto from places like the U.S., China, Hong Kong, Canada, and the U.K. Bybit stores the majority of digital assets in cold wallets and protects them through additional layers of security. Bybit website Pros Excellent for derivatives trading like futures and options. Offers zero-fee P2P trading with 570+ payment methods. Extensive educational resources for beginners. Cons Derivative trading is highly risky for inexperienced traders. Fiat withdrawal fees are variable and depend on the provider. Limited fiat currency support compared to its global availability. Why is Bybit a good alternative to Binance? Bybit is the best Binance alternative for derivatives traders who are looking for high leverage trading of up to 100x. The platform has liquidity depth, tight spreads, and low fees, competing with Binance‚Äôs derivative markets. Bybit is highly responsive and stable during volatile market conditions. OKX:¬†Excellent for Overall Crypto Traders OKX was founded in 2013 by Star Xu and was known as Okcoin. In 2017, the exchange rebranded to OKX and has since grown into one of the world‚Äôs most prominent crypto platforms. Today, OKX serves over 60 million users across more than 200 countries. The platform lists 297 cryptocurrencies across 700+ trading pairs, from Bitcoin and Ethereum to other altcoins. OKX accepts fiat deposits from bank transfers, debit or credit card payments, Apple Pay, and Google Pay. The exchange supports multiple fiat currencies like USD, EUR, CNY, AUD, and others. Deposit fees vary between flat fees, percentage fees, or a combination of both. Cash withdrawals are available on OKX with fees of $30 for wire transfers. OKX also offers zero-fee P2P trading with 900+ local payment methods for seamless fiat on- and off-ramps. OKX has several trading options available, including spot, futures, and options trading. Traders can execute spot trades at 0.14% maker and 0.230% taker fees. The platform offers up to 10X leverage in margin markets and trades derivative contracts, including futures and options. Futures contract fees range between 0.02% maker fees and 0.05% taker fees. Options trading maker/taker fees are set at 0.030%. With daily volumes often exceeding $1.7 billion, OKX ranks as the second-largest exchange by trading volume. Its deep order-book liquidity ensures rapid, low-slippage execution for both retail and institutional orders. Mobile apps on iOS and Android mirror the web interface, letting users trade on the go without missing a beat. OKX employs advanced encryption, two-factor authentication, and stores the majority of funds offline in cold wallets. OKX publishes monthly Proof-of-Reserves (POR) reports to demonstrate full asset backing and operational transparency. It holds multiple regulatory licenses‚Äîincluding MiCA in the EU and a payment institution license from MAS in Singapore. OKX mandates KYC/AML verification for all users. OKX website Pros Offers low trading fees for spot, futures, and options markets. Provide a seamless interface and excellent user experience. Offers a zero-fee P2P trading platform with hundreds of local currencies. Cons Complex trading tools make it unsuitable for beginners. Restricted in major regions like the U.S., Canada, and China. Relies on payment processors, which incur high fees. Why is OKX a good alternative to Binance? OKX is the ideal Binance alternative to users who are looking for an exchange rich with key features and trading markets. OKX offers competitive trading fees and a zero-fee P2P market, just like Binance. If you‚Äôre an experienced trader looking for an exchange packed with features, OKX is your best bet. KuCoin: Top Global Crypto Hub KuCoin is a crypto exchange founded by Michael Gan and Eric Don in 2017. Today, KuCoin operates in over 200 countries and serves more than 40 million users, making it a truly global platform. KuCoin gives you access to over 900 coins and emerging tokens, including BTC, ETH, SOL, and XRP. Plus, the exchange supports 48+ fiat currencies like USD, EUR, AUD, CAD, CHF, and JPY. You can deposit funds via crypto transfers, bank wires, or debit and credit cards. Crypto deposits are free, while fiat deposits may come with fees‚Äîthink a ‚Ç¨1 SEPA charge or a small percentage on card payments. KuCoin offers several trading options. On spot markets, traders pay a flat 0.1% fee for both makers and takers. You can slash that by 20% if you pay with KCS, the exchange‚Äôs native token. KuCoin also supports up to 10X margin trading, as well as futures and options. Futures fees are 0.02% for makers and 0.06% for takers. Other advanced trading features include lending and DeFi staking. Peer-to-peer (P2P) margin trading and lending are available on KuCoin. Institutional-size orders are processed through KuCoin‚Äôs OTC desk. Algorithmic traders can use KuCoin‚Äôs REST and WebSocket APIs for automated trading. In terms of accessibility, KuCoin‚Äôs feature-packed dashboard is available on the web, iOS, and Android devices. Customer support is on hand 24/7 via live chat and email. Learning materials are offered through KuCoin‚Äôs blog and help center guides. KuCoin uses encrypted infrastructure with security features like two-factor authentication and multi-sig wallets. Digital assets are held in cold storage, but KuCoin doesn‚Äôt publish regular proof-of-reserves. KuCoin enforces mandatory KYC and AML checks for its fiat services. It also blocks access from regions like the U.S., China, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Canada. KuCoin website Pros Global presence with access to 900+ coins. Low trading fees plus discounts for KCS holders. Tons of trading options‚Äîspot, margin, derivatives, P2P, and OTC. Cons Unavailable in major regions like the U.S., China, and Canada. Feature-packed interface can overwhelm newbies. No consistent, public proof-of-reserves audits. Why is KuCoin a good alternative to Binance? KuCoin is a solid Binance alternative with low fees, a massive coin lineup, and advanced trading tools. It offers spot and margin to futures trading, P2P, and OTC, just like Binance. If you want to switch from Binance and try a new exchange, KuCoin is an excellent choice. Gate: Best Gateway to Crypto Gate is a global cryptocurrency exchange founded by Dr. Han in 2013. The exchange was known as Bter.com and operated from China. However, it rebranded to Gate and moved to the Cayman Islands due to regulations and restrictions in 2017. Gate is available in over 200 countries and has more than 34 million users worldwide. The exchange lists over 3,500 cryptocurrencies and supports more than 2,661 trading pairs. Users can deposit funds through crypto transfers, credit/debit cards, Apple Pay, Google Pay, or bank wires. Gate supports over 60 fiat currencies, making it easy to buy crypto using your local currency. Gate has a wide range of trading products. Users can buy and sell crypto, trade on spot futures markets, and margin trade. Gate charges a flat 0.1% fee for both makers and takers on spot trades. Futures trading fees stand at 0.02% maker and 0.075% taker. Margin traders can access up to 10X leverage while futures traders can choose between perpetuals and options, and CBBC contracts‚ÄîCallable Bull/Bear Contracts. Gate offers flexible and fixed staking products as well as copy-trading features for social trading. It also provides a zero-fee P2P marketplace and an OTC desk for low-slippage orders with liquidity depth and tight spreads. Developers and institutional traders can scale and automate trading through Gate‚Äôs API access. The web and mobile apps feature intuitive dashboards. Gate offers advanced charting tools for traders at all levels. Customer support is available 24/7 through live chat and email ticketing. Security measures at Gate are high. It includes multi-signature cold wallets, two-factor authentication, and real-time risk controls. The exchange has insurance coverage, protecting users from any immoderate losses or liquidations. Gate has published monthly Proof-of-Reserves (PORs) audits since 2020, confirming 1:1 asset backing for all users. Gate is licensed and registered in several countries, including Hong Kong, Argentina, the Bahamas, Gibraltar, Italy, Lithuania, Malta, and the UAE. Gate website Pros Supports 3,500 coins and 2,661 trading pairs. User-friendly, intuitive interface. Routine proof-of-reserves (POR) audits since 2020. Cons Occasional withdrawal delays. A history of alleged hacks and security breaches. Not available in the U.S. Why is Gate.io a good alternative to Binance? If you‚Äôre a frequent trader looking for a variety of coins, then Gate is the best alternative to Binance. Gate beats Binance with 3,500+ cryptocurrencies on its roster. Bitget:¬†Best for Copy Trading Bitget was founded by Sanjay Jain in 2018. It has grown into a leading crypto exchange and Web3 company with 120 million registered users. The platform is accessible in over 150 countries and regions, making seamless trading of crypto available globally. Bitget supports trading Bitcoin and 680 coins across 780 trading pairs. The exchange lets you deposit crypto and fiat through various methods, including credit/debit cards, P2P trading, bank transfers, cash conversion, and other third-party channels. Bitget supports 14 fiat currencies for bank deposits‚Äîlike EUR, RUB, AUD, CAD, CHF, and more. Bitget users trade on spot and margin markets. Spot trades incur 0.1% maker and taker fees, which drop to 0.08% when you pay with BGB, the exchange‚Äôs native token. Margin trading offers up to 10X leverage, with 0.1% maker/taker fees plus interest on borrowed funds. Futures trading is available on Bitget with maker/take fees of 0.02% and 0.06%. Further fee discounts are applicable for BGB holders and volume traders. Bitget offers copy trading from 2020, allowing users to mirror trading strategies with a few clicks. The exchange charges a 10‚Äì20% profit-sharing fee on copied trades, paid to elite traders. Bitget‚Äôs copy-trading volume hit $9.2 billion in the first quarter of 2025. Bitget employs offline multi-sig cold storage and 2FA, protecting user assets and accounts. It publishes monthly proof-of-reserves reports that show all user funds are fully backed. Additionally, a protection fund of $300 million provides an extra safety net against unexpected incidents. Bitget website Pros Low trading fees with potential discounts. Pioneer in copy trading with high volumes. Robust security, routine reserves audits, and insured funds. Cons Limited fiat options. Limited earn products. Occasional downtime during peak trading periods. Why is Bitget a good alternative to Binance? Bitget is the best alternative to Binance for traders looking for a feature-rich copy-trading exchange. It boasts massive volume and a huge pool of advanced strategists to follow. If you want to switch from Binance to an exchange with a more hands-off, social trading vibe, Bitget is the perfect pick. Bitstamp:¬†Excellent for Easy Trading Bitstamp launched in 2011 in Slovenia by co-founders Damian Merlak and Nejc Kodriƒç. It serves over 5 million users across more than 100 countries. Bitstamp offers access to 101 crypto coins and 224 trading pairs. Moreover, it supports fiat deposits in USD, EUR, and GBP only. Crypto and SEPA deposits carry zero fees, while crypto withdrawals cost network fees and SEPA takes ‚Ç¨3. Users can get started with Bitstamp through the mobile app. Its simplicity makes it easy to buy and sell crypto. The app lets users access Bitstamp Earn and stake coins like ETH and ADA. Pro traders can spot trade and execute instant orders, market orders, limit orders, and stop orders. A trailing stop order lets pro traders execute dynamic buy or sell orders. Spot trading fees start at 0.30% maker and 0.40% taker, with tiered volume discounts for active traders. Margin trading is available with leverage of up to 5X. Derivatives trading is not available; however, Bitstamp will offer it in the future. Institutional clients can access an OTC desk and trade between $100K and $2M per transaction. Tech-savvy users can connect bots to Bitstamp‚Äôs REST and WebSocket APIs and automate strategies for trading. The web and mobile apps feature an intuitive interface alongside a learning center with guides and tutorials. Customer support is available 24/7 via live chat, email, and phone calls. Multi-language support extends beyond English to serve a global audience. Security measures include encryption and two-factor authentication. Multi-signature cold wallets hold 95% of assets, while the remaining 5% is available on an online wallet. Bitstamp maintains 100% backing of all customer assets‚Äîholding them 1:1 in custody. Bitstamp is regulated and licensed in over 50 countries. It‚Äôs overseen by Luxembourg‚Äôs CSSF and was the first MiCA-licensed exchange. In addition, Bitstamp is registered in the U.S. with FinCEN and in Canada with FINTRAC. It‚Äôs also in regulatory compliance in the UK by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA). Bitstamp mandates KYC and AML checks for all users, with innovative features varying by jurisdiction. Bitstamp website Pros Simple and easy to use. Highly regulated and licensed in 50+ countries. Well-established exchange, running for 14 years. Cons Staking products aren‚Äôt available everywhere. Limited fiat currency options. No derivatives trading. Why is Bitstamp a good alternative to Binance? Bitstamp is the best Binance alternative for users who want a highly regulated exchange that‚Äôs easy to use but with some advanced features. If you‚Äôre looking to buy and sell crypto and access staking and spot trading, Bitstamp is the go-to choice. MEXC:¬†Best for Altcoins and Airdrops MEXC is a crypto exchange launched in 2018 and founded by Metin Mehmet Durgun and John Chen Ju. As of 2025, MEXC serves over 40 million users across more than 170 countries. It lists over 4,000 coins with 2,820 spot trading pairs and 810 futures trading pairs. MEXC stands out for altcoins by hosting a curated new listing calendar that adds dozens of tokens each week. Its Airdrop+ program runs 200+ simultaneous token drops with reward pools exceeding $17 million. On-Chain Bounty Airdrops feature up to $50 million USDT in prizes for completing simple on-chain tasks. MEXC supports 50+ fiat currencies such as USD, EUR, GBP, AED, and BRL. Deposit fees vary depending on the payment method. Deposit channels include SEPA bank transfers, credit/debit cards, Apple Pay, Google Pay, on-chain crypto transfers, and more. Onchain withdrawals incur network fees while SEPA withdrawals incur minimal fees. MEXC stands out when it comes to trading fees. Spot trading fees are 0% maker and 0.05% taker, while futures carry 0% maker and 0.020% taker fees. Traders can use up to 125X leverage on futures and access 2‚Äì5X leveraged ETFs. Copy trading is available on MEXC, letting users mirror trading strategies from pro traders. MEXC also offers savings products for 25+ tokens‚Äîlike SOL and USDC‚Äîwith varying APYs. Institutional investors benefit from an OTC desk and pre-market block trading for large, low-slippage orders. A zero-fee P2P crypto market is available on the exchange as well. Developers can plug into MEXC‚Äôs REST and WebSocket APIs to power trading bots and automate their strategies. MEXC has an intuitive web interface and mobile apps (iOS & Android) that make trading seamless on any device. The exchange has a learning hub, helping users learn about crypto and navigate the exchange. Security features include 2FA, encryption, multi-signature cold storage, anti-phishing codes, withdrawal whitelisting, and a bug-bounty program. MEXC maintains a dashboard showing 1:1 backing across spot, fiat, and futures accounts. It publishes public proof-of-reserves and enforces mandatory KYC/AML checks on all users. MEXC website Pros Wide range of altcoins and airdrops. Ultra-low fees of 0% maker and 0.05% taker on spot. Public dashboard showing assets backed 1:1. Cons No direct fiat withdrawals. Instant buys are limited to less than 100 coins. Overwhelming for newcomers. Why is MEXC a good alternative to Binance? If you‚Äôre hunting for new altcoins and airdrops, MEXC is the best Binance alternative. It runs a curated listing calendar and huge airdrop events. Plus, MEXC has ultra-low fees and deep liquidity, making it a contender to Binance. Decentralized Binance Alternatives Decentralized exchanges (DEXs) represent a trustless alternative to Binance compared to other crypto exchanges. DEXs run entirely on smart-contract protocols and execute transactions directly on the blockchain. No KYC verification is required. All you need is a Web3 wallet (e.g. MetaMask), a few network-native tokens for gas, and you‚Äôre ready to swap coins on the blockchain. DEXs are the fastest path to crypto trading. However, they are ideal for tech-savvy and advanced users, who understand on-chain data and know how to use network explorers like BSC scan. PancakeSwap PancakeSwap is a decentralized exchange (DEX) and automated market maker (AMM) that operates on the BNB Smart Chain. It enables DeFi transactions and activities, including BEP-20 token swaps, staking, yield farming, liquidity provision, and more. The DEX is powered by the native governance token CAKE, which has a buyback-and-burn mechanism. PancakeSwap is the best alternative DEX to Binance since it‚Äôs built on the BNB Smart Chain. It offers access to a variety of Binance support tokens with 706 listed tokens and 1,320 trading pairs. Pancake pumps billions of dollars in trading volume like its centralized counterpart, Binance. Uniswap Uniswap is one of the earliest and top decentralized exchanges in the crypto space. It‚Äôs the best Binance alternative for traders looking for exposure to the Ethereum network. Uniswap enables swaps on other networks, including Binance Smart Chain (BSC), as well as other layer-2 chains. The DEX boasts billions of dollars worth of trading volumes across all networks, making it more versatile than Binance. Uniswap V3 on BSC has 150 tokens and 286 trading pairs, while Uniswap V4 on BSC lists 54 tokens and 138 trading pairs. On Ethereum, Uniswap has thousands of tokens and trading pairs, giving traders a variety of options and deep liquidity. The UNI token is Uniswap‚Äôs native token, fueling the ecosystem with governance, staking, yield farming, and other DeFi activities. SunSwap Sunswap is a decentralized exchange built on the Tron network. The DEX has less trading volume compared to PancakeSwap and Uniswap, but it‚Äôs the best choice for traders moving from Binance to the Tron ecosystem. Sunswap lists 77 coins across 127 trading pairs. That figure combines both Sunswap V2 and V3. Most of Sunswap‚Äôs trading volume occurs in the USDT/WTRX pair, making its trading options somewhat limited. Overall, Sunswap is the best pick for decentralized trading of Tron tokens after Binance. What to look for in a Binance alternative? Listed Cryptocurrencies Rich availability of cryptocurrencies on a centralized exchange is vital for winning users over. When looking for a Binance alternative, it‚Äôs important to look at the number of listed coins. Binance has 407 coins available for trading across 1,478 pairs. Any alternative to Binance should match‚Äîor ideally beat‚Äîthat lineup. Deposit Methods Binance covers a wide range of deposit methods. You can easily transfer fiat via bank deposits, credit and debit cards, or even Apple Pay and Google Pay. If you‚Äôd rather not use any of those, you can always hop onto Binance‚Äôs P2P market to pay or cash out. A solid Binance alternative should offer multiple deposit options and local payment channels. And since Binance supports 35 fiat currencies, a great alternative should match or beat that. Fees Exploring fees on alternatives to Binance is a make-or-break point. Competing with Binance is tough as it offers some of the cheapest trading fees in the crypto market. Binance charges a base fee of 0.1%, which you can drop to 0.075% by using BNB. A solid Binance alternative should match those rates. Most centralized exchanges sweeten the deal for volume traders, so finding one that fits your trading style without eating into your profits is key. Trading Products and Volume Finding the right trading product that matches your needs is a big deal. Binance boasts options like spot trading, margin trading, derivatives trading, and even social or copy trading. A solid Binance alternative should offer a mix of trading features‚Äîor at least the ones you need. And of course, the trading volume should be hefty, hovering close to Binance‚Äôs overall volume. Learning Resources Guides and content geared towards teaching users how to use an exchange are critical. The Binance Academy is one of the earliest and most popular crypto learning hubs. An alternative to Binance should offer extensive learning materials and guides that help users learn and navigate its platform. Most crypto platforms have followed in the footsteps of Binance and created an equivalent to the Binance Academy. Look for an exchange that has learning materials that are easy to find and consume. Supported Countries Binance does not support all countries. If you live in one of these countries and need an alternative to Binance, look for a centralized exchange with similar features, perks, versatility, and volume that‚Äôs legally allowed in your area. Security Trading on a highly secure centralized exchange is paramount. Binance has strong security measures in place. Most user funds are held offline, and reserves are audited monthly. A proof of reserves (POR) audit helps verify that assets are backed 1:1, and that‚Äôs important. On the user side, Binance enforces 2FA, anti-phishing codes, withdrawal whitelisting, and real-time risk management. Look for an alternative to Binance that has public, transparent records of its asset holdings and strong account security protocols. Wrapping Up The crypto space is full of exchanges trying to attract users and win them over. Binance is the number one crypto exchange in the world in terms of trading volume, making it the right crypto exchange for investment opportunities. However, there are other top crypto exchanges trying to secure a slice of the market. And some people want an alternative to Binance due to restrictions or just to switch things up and try a new trading experience. Whether you‚Äôre hunting for lower fees, deeper liquidity, a bigger coin roster, or a more social trading vibe, there‚Äôs a Binance alternative out there that‚Äôs just right for you.

title: Scammers Spoof Wells Fargo Phone Number To Steal $5,800 After Fake ‚ÄòBest Buy‚Äô Purchase Alert: Report
body: An equestrian coach reportedly lost thousands after falling victim to a spoofing scam that offered to protect her bank account from fraud. NBC 7 in San Diego reports that in June, Alixe Garcia received a text asking her if she authorized a large purchase at Best Buy. Garcia received a call after texting back ‚Äúno‚Äù. She says she trusted the call the moment she answered the phone because the caller ID showed it was from a Wells Fargo customer service number. Garcia says that during the 41-minute call, it sounded as if she was talking with someone who was able to view her accounts. She ended up transferring $5,700 to Apple Cash, believing that the money would be deposited into her new Wells Fargo account that the caller supposedly helped her create. Thirty minutes later, when she logged in, the money was not there. ‚ÄúI waited another 30 minutes. I‚Äôm, like, ‚ÄòMaybe it‚Äôs a little slow.‚Äô No money. Then I was just, like, sick thinking about it.‚Äù She called the bank the next morning, but the agent told her that the person she was talking to was not from the bank. Her money is also gone. Wells Fargo says that its security controls were functioning as intended, and Garcia ultimately authorized the transfers. The bank warns consumers that if they get a similar call asking them to send a payment, transfer funds or send their physical cards to stop fraud in their account, they should immediately hang up and call their bank directly. ‚ÄúSafeguarding our customers‚Äô assets is our top priority, and we are actively working to raise awareness of common scams through various resources and ongoing education. We have robust security measures in place and conduct thorough investigations of fraud and scam reports before making claim decisions.‚Äù Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Don't Miss a Beat ‚Äì Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. Investors should do their due diligence before making any high-risk investments in Bitcoin, cryptocurrency or digital assets. Please be advised that your transfers and trades are at your own risk, and any losses you may incur are your responsibility. The Daily Hodl does not recommend the buying or selling of any cryptocurrencies or digital assets, nor is The Daily Hodl an investment advisor. Please note that The Daily Hodl participates in affiliate marketing. title: Meme Currency Reloaded: Why XRPINU Is More Than a Joke
body: What if the next serious contender in crypto wore a clown nose? Memecoins have been the punchline and the payday of the crypto space. Dogecoin barked its way to mainstream stardom, Shiba Inu wagged behind with a vengeance, and the rest tried to go viral overnight. But in 2025, things are shifting. XRPINU enters the scene not as a copycat, but as a clever remix - one that understands both the power of satire and the need for a solid backbone. It's crypto culture with a master plan. Irony, Meet Infrastructure XRPINU is a memecoin that laughs at the industry while learning from it. Its branding echoes XRP, but with a smirk. Its slogans are ridiculous, yet calculated. And behind all the fun is a presale system, tokenomics, and roadmap that could put some utility tokens to shame. You‚Äôll find: A parody logo and meme art that ridicule crypto‚Äôs usual seriousness A 15-stage presale structure with rising price incentives $1 million in USDT set aside for liquidity - no empty hype This is not just trolling. It‚Äôs tactical. Tokenomics That Know What They‚Äôre Doing Supply: 100,000,000,000 XRPINU tokens Presale: 75 billion tokens, sold in structured phases Launch Liquidity: 10 billion tokens + $1M USDT Each presale stage increases in price, creating FOMO but with clarity. Liquidity is pre-funded and locked, solving the rug-pull paranoia that haunts many memecoins. It's built to reward early participants while staying transparent. From Meme Thread to Real Thread This isn‚Äôt a one-hit wonder. The XRPINU roadmap stretches into 2026: Q3 2025 - Website and community go live, meme contests and early marketing Q4 2025 - DEX debut, token listings, liquidity locked Q1 2026 - Expansion to centralized exchanges, launch of voting tools Q2 2026 - XRPINU Wallet release, early integration of features Q3 2026 - Real-life events, possible blockchain spin-off begins testing Where others fade, XRPINU intends to evolve. Viral by Design The community isn‚Äôt just invited - it‚Äôs the engine. XRPINU‚Äôs team knows that the memecoin market is built on social momentum. So it‚Äôs designed with: Cartoon versions of crypto insiders and regulators Twitter raids and Telegram engagement strategies Governance features that let holders decide the project‚Äôs fate It‚Äôs Dogecoin energy with DAO ambitions. How to Join the Movement Connect a crypto wallet (MetaMask or ERC-compatible) Select ETH, USDT, or SOL to purchase XRPINU Claim tokens after the presale - early buyers get the best price Buy-in is straightforward, and each new stage of the presale raises the price. Timing matters. Final Take: The Smartest Joke in Crypto? XRPINU doesn‚Äôt pretend to be something it‚Äôs not. It is a meme. But it‚Äôs also a calculated, community-first token that‚Äôs looking past launch day. In an age where even serious projects go nowhere, maybe the ones with a punchline and a plan are what the space really needs. This isn‚Äôt Dogecoin 2.0. It‚Äôs something else entirely. >> VISIT THE PRESALE! Disclaimer: This is a sponsored article and is for informational purposes only. It does not reflect the views of Crypto Daily, nor is it intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, or financial advice.

title: Donald Trump Says Reciprocal Tariffs Take Effect at Midnight, ‚ÄúBillions‚Äù to Flow
body: President Trump announces reciprocal tariffs on 60+ countries effective midnight. The US average tariff rate reaches 18.3%, down from a 27% peak earlier in 2025. India and Brazil face the steepest 50% rates, while China maintains a 30% truce. President Donald Trump announced that reciprocal tariffs on over 60 countries worldwide take effect at midnight. He also claimed that ‚Äúbillions of dollars‚Äù will begin flowing into the United States treasury. The President posted on Truth Social that countries that have ‚Äútaken advantage‚Äù of America for years will now contribute substantial revenue. Trump‚Äôs latest tariff regime creates the most comprehensive trade protection system implemented during his administration. The average applied US tariff rate stands at 18.3% as of August 2025, down from a peak of 27% reached earlier this year. India and Brazil Face Maximum 50% Tariff Rates India confronts the highest tariff burden at 50%, comprising a 25% baseline rate plus an additional 25% penalty for purchasing Russian oil. This base will take effect today, and the additional one on August 27 as part of efforts to discourage energy trade with sanctioned nations. Sou‚Ä¶ The post Donald Trump Says Reciprocal Tariffs Take Effect at Midnight, ‚ÄúBillions‚Äù to Flow appeared first on Coin Edition .

title: India Chases Crypto Tax Evaders With Over 44,000 Warning Notices
body: Crypto traders across India are cautioned to report their transactions to avoid late penalties. India‚Äôs Finance Act of 2022 introduced a 30% flat tax on crypto gains. Crackdown on crypto traders is facilitated through registered crypto exchanges and P2P platforms. India‚Äôs Income Tax Department has sent notices to 44,057 cryptocurrency traders who it believes failed to report their transactions for the 2025 financial year. In a massive outreach , authorities have warned traders to update their tax filings to avoid further scrutiny, penalties, or even prosecution. High-Tech Push for Crypto Tax Compliance As the government intensifies the scrutiny on crypto transactions using modern technology, including artificial intelligence (AI) and data analytics tools, it has become more difficult for Indian traders to evade. In a recent parliamentary reply, the tax department revealed that the government has collected ‚Çπ269.09 crore (approx. $32.2 million) in taxes from crypto income. What Are India‚Äôs Crypto Tax Rules? This enforcement action is based on the strict tax regime India implemented in 2022. The rules include a 30% flat tax on all income from‚Ä¶ The post India Chases Crypto Tax Evaders With Over 44,000 Warning Notices appeared first on Coin Edition .

title: Rubio launches diplomatic pushback against EU Digital Services Act
body: The US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has instructed diplomats across Europe to lobby against the European Union‚Äôs Digital Services Act (DSA), arguing it restricts freedom of speech and unfairly targets American tech companies. According to a diplomatic cable seen by Reuters , Rubio signed off on a directive dated 4 August ordering US embassies to engage European officials and push for changes to the landmark legislation. Rubio wants a campaign to amend or repeal the law The DSA came into force earlier this year as part of the EU‚Äôs efforts to regulate digital platforms. It requires large tech firms to do more to tackle illegal online content, including hate speech, misinformation and child abuse material. But Washington views the rules as overreaching. The cable, described as an ‚Äúaction request‚Äù, says the DSA imposes ‚Äúundue‚Äù restrictions on expression and burdens US firms with excessive compliance costs. Diplomats were told to lobby for ‚Äúrepeal and/or amendment‚Äù of the DSA or related laws across the EU‚Äôs 27 member states. ‚ÄúPosts should focus efforts to build host government and other stakeholder support,‚Äù the directive said, adding that suggested talking points would be provided. It also urged envoys to track incidents of what it called ‚Äúcensorship‚Äù, defined as any state or corporate action to suppress protected expression. Examples listed included arrests, court cases and online suspensions involving US citizens or firms. The US State Department declined to comment. The office of EU tech commissioner Henna Virkkunen did not immediately respond to a request for comment. A key concern for Washington is the DSA‚Äôs broad definition of ‚Äú illegal content ‚Äù. The US wants that definition narrowed to protect political and religious speech. Officials are also calling for the EU to scale back fines for non-compliance and reconsider its use of ‚Äútrusted flaggers‚Äù, groups empowered to report problematic content directly to platforms. They also suggest rolling back the Code of Practice on Disinformation, a framework set up under the DSA that the US says enables overly restrictive content moderation. In March, the head of the US Federal Communications Commission said the DSA clashed with America‚Äôs First Amendment traditions. Vice President JD Vance has previously accused the EU of suppressing speech by right-wing parties, including Germany‚Äôs AfD, remarks that drew sharp criticism from European leaders. American tech firms back Washington‚Äôs stance Major US platforms have also voiced concern. Meta , which owns Facebook and Instagram, has warned the rules risk turning into censorship. Elon Musk, owner of X (formerly Twitter), has also pushed back on EU content moderation policies. Other US tech giants, including Google-owner Alphabet , and Amazon, have remained relatively quiet but are widely seen as affected by the DSA‚Äôs strict requirements. President Trump has made online free speech a central issue, accusing the previous Biden administration of encouraging censorship. In a high-profile ruling last year, the US Supreme Court found the Biden White House had not violated free speech protections when urging platforms to limit misinformation on vaccines and elections. Now, under Trump‚Äôs leadership, Rubio has taken a harder line. In May, he floated visa bans for foreign officials who ‚Äúcensor‚Äù Americans online and hinted that regulators targeting US companies could face consequences. Despite US objections, the EU maintains that the DSA is not aimed at American firms. ‚ÄúThis legislation will not be changed. The DMA and the DSA are not on the table in the trade negotiations with the US,‚Äù Commission spokesperson Thomas Regnier said earlier this year. European officials insist the rules are necessary to ensure safety and transparency in the digital space, and to hold tech platforms accountable. Whether Washington‚Äôs diplomatic pressure will sway EU capitals remains unclear. But the move marks a rare and public transatlantic clash over how to govern the online world, one that could shape global tech regulation for years to come. Get seen where it counts. Advertise in Cryptopolitan Research and reach crypto‚Äôs sharpest investors and builders.

title: Bitcoin (BTC) Quiet Now, But Is a Big Storm Brewing?
body: Bitcoin (BTC) continues to traverse up and down with no big moves in either direction. However, the clouds are starting to gather as something big takes shape just over the horizon. Is this the storm that is going to send Bitcoin into its final blow-off top stage, or will it send the price crashing into the next bear market? Bull flags are bullish When Bitcoin has been going sideways for around three weeks in a bull flag pattern that is much smaller than the previous flag that took around six weeks to break, it is probably time to sit up and start taking notice. A bull flag pattern says it all in the name - it's bullish. Also, it‚Äôs a bull flag pattern that has formed at the back end of this bull market cycle. The probabilities of this breaking to the upside are pretty good. $BTC price back inside bull flag Source: TradingView The 4-hour chart for $BTC shows how the price has now crept its way back into the bull flag after many traders were undoubtedly liquidated due to the sweep down to $112,000. Be that as it may, this test of the $112,000 horizontal support laid a foundation down, confirming it as an important price structure level. The W pattern, which looked as though it might break out, refused to do so, and the price was stopped in its tracks and rejected at the neckline. That said, there is the possibility that the price has another go at the neckline, and a W pattern could still play out, albeit not the original one. RSI points to potential huge move Source: TradingView The daily chart illustrates how the price has been bouncing from the 50-day SMA, and how it has spent the last three days consolidating inside the bull flag. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) at the bottom of the chart provides a bullish possibility. Looking left, it can be seen that when the indicator line last broke through the yellow moving average and the descending trendline, the price action moved up 25%, corresponding to a move of nearly $25,000. If the indicator line can angle upwards and break through these two barriers again, a move of a similar magnitude could begin. The indicator line will need to be watched very closely. Inverse head and shoulders pattern Vs Stochastic RSI indicators Source: TradingView The weekly chart shows the inverse head and shoulders pattern that could provide the signal for this next stage of the bull run. As can be seen above, the $BTC price broke through the neckline of this pattern, came back to confirm the breakout, and all being well we could see a lift-off from here. Running contrary to this very bullish looking candle pattern, the Stochastic RSI at the bottom of the chart reveals that the indicator lines are breaking back down. If they are going to head back to the bottom, this would likely negate the inverse head and shoulders pattern. These indicators need to turn back around and the 50.00 level could provide the support where this takes place. Indicator lines need to be watched like a hawk. title: US May Retry Tornado Dev Roman Storm on Money Laundering, Sanctions Charges
body: The United States Department of Justice (DOJ) is considering a retrial for Tornado Cash developer Roman Storm after a partial verdict left two major charges unresolved. While Storm was convicted on one felony count, conspiracy to operate an unlicensed money transmitting business, the jury could not reach a unanimous decision on charges of conspiracy to commit money laundering and conspiracy to violate U.S. sanctions against North Korea. Legal experts say the DOJ‚Äôs decision on whether to proceed with a retrial is expected in the coming days. The unresolved charges center around allegations that Storm‚Äôs involvement in developing Tornado Cash facilitated criminal use of the protocol, including funds tied to state-sponsored North Korean hackers. Legal Fallout and Industry Concerns Storm‚Äôs trial has been closely watched by both the cryptocurrency industry and digital privacy advocates. Legal experts argue the case sets a critical precedent, not only for privacy-preserving blockchain tools but also for open-source developers in general. ‚ÄúThis is a sad day for DeFi,‚Äù said Jake Chervinsky, chief legal officer at Variant Fund, on X. He emphasized that Storm‚Äôs conviction under U.S. Code Section 1960‚Äîused to prosecute unlicensed money transmitters‚Äîposes a serious threat to the decentralized finance ecosystem. Attorney Zack Shapiro echoed similar concerns, calling the outcome ‚Äúpretty depressing‚Äù but noted that at least the more severe charges‚Äîmoney laundering and sanctions violations‚Äîdid not result in immediate convictions. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs good the draconian sentencing is off the table, for now,‚Äù he posted on X. Tornado Cash Faces Broader Legal Struggle Tornado Cash, a crypto mixing service, has long been in the crosshairs of U.S. authorities. In 2022, the U.S. Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) imposed sanctions on the protocol, citing its alleged use in laundering over $7 billion worth of cryptocurrency. This included funds linked to North Korean hackers tied to cyberattacks and theft. However, in a surprise legal victory for the crypto industry, a U.S. court overturned those OFAC sanctions in January 2025. The ruling gave a boost to privacy-preserving protocols and open-source software advocates, though the Storm case remains a complex legal battleground. If the DOJ decides to retry the unresolved counts, the outcome could have long-lasting effects on how decentralized technologies and their developers are regulated in the United States. The post US May Retry Tornado Dev Roman Storm on Money Laundering, Sanctions Charges appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .
tags: Finance and Business News|Roman Storm trial|Tornado Cash Roman Storm

title: AAVE users at risk as scammers use Google ads to promote fake DeFi website
body: Crypto scammers have once again resorted to using Google ads to promote phishing sites, this time targeting decentralised finance protocol Aave with a fake website designed to drain users‚Äô wallets. On Thursday, August 7, blockchain security firm PeckShield raised the alarm about a fake ad impersonating Aave that appeared at the top of Google search results. Fake ad displayed as top result. Source: PeckSheildAlert on X. According to the firm‚Äôs security alert, the malicious ad linked to a phishing domain ‚Äî aaxe.co.com ‚Äî which mimicked Aave‚Äôs legitimate website in an attempt to deceive users. PeckShield urged the crypto community not to interact with the ad and to verify the authenticity of DeFi websites before engaging. As of presstime, the Aave team had yet to acknowledge the issue. Meanwhile, the malicious ad was no longer visible when looking up Aave on Google. Are AAVE users at risk? Yes, such scams, although not new, pose significant risks to any cryptocurrency enthusiast who is not careful enough to verify the web address. The scam works by redirecting unsuspecting users to the fake Aave site to access and drain digital assets from connected wallets, especially as the fraudulent interface closely mirrors that of the real Aave platform, with only subtle differences that can be spotted on thorough examination. Phishing attacks like this rely on deception rather than brute force. Instead of requiring victims to reveal private keys or passwords, attackers manipulate them into approving transactions that hand over wallet permissions. Once a user signs such a transaction, the smart contract grants control to the scammer‚Äôs address, enabling them to transfer funds out without further authorisation. This attack vector is especially dangerous in the decentralised finance (DeFi) space, where transactions are irreversible and user protection mechanisms are limited. For an average Aave user, falling for such a scam could mean the loss of funds supplied as liquidity, collateral, or borrowed tokens, all without any recourse for recovery. Moreover, malicious approvals can persist indefinitely if not manually revoked, exposing wallets to future risks. Scammers continue targeting crypto users via Google For Google, this is not a novel problem. Over the past years, there have been several recorded incidents of such ads popping up when a user looks up a legitimate cryptocurrency project on Google search. For instance, last month, a DeFi user lost over $1.23 million in Uniswap NFTs after interacting with a fake site that appeared as a top Google ad result. In some cases, scammers have even impersonated tools like revoke.cash ‚Äî targeting users who were already trying to recover from earlier attacks, effectively turning past victims into victims again. Why hasn‚Äôt Google addressed crypto scams? Google hasn‚Äôt been sitting on the sidelines and has taken several steps to curb abuse of its ad platform in the form of lawsuits and bans. In early 2024, the tech giant sued two Chinese nationals, Yunfeng Sun and Hongnam Cheung, for promoting fake crypto investments through apps on the Google Play Store. Google claimed it had disabled 90 fraudulent apps linked to the pair, which had accumulated nearly 100,000 downloads. The year before, Google reported blocking 5.5 billion ads and suspending 12.7 million advertiser accounts for violations related to scams and misrepresentation. The company also introduced a ‚ÄúLimited Ads Serving‚Äù policy to restrict reach for advertisers lacking an established track record. However, despite these efforts, scammers continue to find ways around Google‚Äôs filters . As such, experts urge users to exercise caution when interacting with links in search results, especially sponsored links related to crypto platforms or wallet services. The post AAVE users at risk as scammers use Google ads to promote fake DeFi website appeared first on Invezz
